docs.summary: The [React component](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-editor-elements/react-components/about-the-wix-react-component) element allows you to add your own [React](https://react.dev/) component.
description: > This feature is currently only available in [Wix Studio](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/coding-with-wix-studio/about-coding-with-wix-studio).
Wix's React Component allows you to add your own [React](https://react.dev/) component to your site, expanding the range of components that are available in the Wix editor.
You can either import an existing component in the React ecosystem to the Wix editor and use it in your code, or write your own React component from scratch.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the React component's [props](https://react.dev/learn/passing-props-to-a-component).
description: Use props to pass information to your React component. Each React component determines which props it supports. You can pass any supported props in the `props` object. The `props` object is a key-value pair.

You can set a prop that defines a callback function that runs when an event is triggered on the React component. For example, an event handler with a [`ReactEvent`](https://dev.wix.com/docs/velo/velo-only-apis/$w/react-event/context). Passing a callback function allows you to handle React events in your code. See the code example, **Pass a function in the React component's props**.
>**Note:** Each time you set the `props` object you replace the entire previous object. Partial updates are not supported.
